snippet: Fox has canceled its costly science-fiction series “Terra Nova,” and the studio that produces it is seeking another network willing to run it.
abstract: Twentieth Century Fox Television, the studio that produces the science-fiction series Terra Nova, hopes to find a new network willing to air the program after it was cancelled by the Fox Network due to high cost and declining ratings; cancellation adds another negative mark on the mixed television record of Steven Spielberg, who served as executive producer of the show.
lead_paragraph: Fox has canceled its costly science-fiction series “Terra Nova,” and the studio that produces it is seeking another network willing to run it.

headline.seo: Fox Ends Sci-Fi Show About Time Travel
headline.main: ‘Terra Nova’ Is Canceled, but Seeks New Home
headline.print_headline: ‘Terra Nova’ Is Canceled, But Seeks New Home
